channel.title: Java Bug System
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [JDK-8205129] Remove java.lang.Compiler

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
I contributed a patch to Dacapo which removes all avrora calls to java.lang.Compiler:

https://github.com/dacapobench/dacapobench/pull/219

I verified that I could run avrora successfully with this patch applied.

Let's hope someone picks this up. The latest Dacapo release seems to be from July 2019, so releases are probably not frequent.

dacapo-9.12-MR1 seems to be the most recent binary/download release of Dacao. It uses avrora-cvs-20091224

The current git main uses avrora-cvs-20131011, which unfortunately still seems to call java.lang.Compiler.compileClass.

The good part is that Dacapo builds avrora from source and applies patches before doing so. So it should be possible for Dacapo maintainers (Oracle?) to remove the calls to Compiler.compile without fixing this upstream.

> Avrora [Beta 1.7.110] - (c) 2003-2007 UCLA Compilers Group

This seems very old, I see avrora.arch.legacy.LegacyInterpreter calls Compiler.compileClass(getClass()) with a comment to say that speed up was observed on HotSpot. This seems a bit dubious as Compiler.compileClass seems to have always been a no-op on HotSpot.

Is this simulator still maintained? Does dacapo have a fork of this code that would allow patching of this code to remove this useless call?

I downloaded Dacapo and reproduced the issue. I then ran the avrora main method directly:

% java -cp scratch/jar/avrora-cvs-20091224.jar avrora.Main -seconds=30 -platform=mica2 -simulation=sensor-network -nodecount=2,1 -stagger-start=1000000 ./scratch/test/tinyos/CntToRfm.elf ./scratch/test/tinyos/RfmToLeds.elf

Avrora [Beta 1.7.110] - (c) 2003-2007 UCLA Compilers Group
Loading ./scratch/test/tinyos/CntToRfm.elf...OK
Loading ./scratch/test/tinyos/RfmToLeds.elf...OK
=={ Simulation events }=======================================================
Node Time Event
Simulation terminated with unexpected exception: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: java/lang/Compiler
at avrora.sim.AtmelInterpreter.<init>(AtmelInterpreter.java:324)
at avrora.arch.legacy.LegacyInterpreter.<init>(LegacyInterpreter.java:74)
at avrora.arch.legacy.LegacyInterpreter$Factory.newInterpreter(LegacyInterpreter.java:54)
at avrora.sim.Simulator.<init>(Simulator.java:111)
at avrora.sim.Simulation.createSimulator(Simulation.java:342)
at avrora.sim.mcu.ATMega128.<init>(ATMega128.java:371)
at avrora.sim.platform.Mica2$Factory.newPlatform(Mica2.java:73)
at avrora.sim.Simulation$Node.instantiate(Simulation.java:157)
at avrora.sim.types.SensorSimulation$SensorNode.createNode(SensorSimulation.java:177)
at avrora.sim.types.SensorSimulation$SensorNode.instantiate(SensorSimulation.java:161)
at avrora.sim.Simulation.instantiateNodes(Simulation.java:465)
at avrora.sim.Simulation.start(Simulation.java:454)
at avrora.actions.SimAction.run(SimAction.java:96)
at avrora.Main.runAction(Main.java:140)
at avrora.Main.main(Main.java:120)
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: java.lang.Compiler
at java.base/jdk.internal.loader.BuiltinClassLoader.loadClass(BuiltinClassLoader.java:641)
at java.base/jdk.internal.loader.ClassLoaders$AppClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoaders.java:188)
at java.base/java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:526)
... 15 more

Not sure whether this is an issue, but I witnessed validation failure after this commit when running Dacapo avrora on aarch64-linux platform.

$ java -jar dacapo-9.12-MR1-bach.jar -s small avrora
===== DaCapo 9.12-MR1 avrora starting =====
Digest validation failed for stderr.log, expecting 0xda39a3ee5e6b4b0d3255bfef95601890afd80709 found 0xaa86937199bc918a27c5a47323a796007316e983
===== DaCapo 9.12-MR1 avrora FAILED =====
Validation FAILED for avrora small

$ java -Xint -jar dacapo-9.12-MR1-bach.jar -s small avrora
===== DaCapo 9.12-MR1 avrora starting =====
Digest validation failed for stderr.log, expecting 0xda39a3ee5e6b4b0d3255bfef95601890afd80709 found 0xaa86937199bc918a27c5a47323a796007316e983
===== DaCapo 9.12-MR1 avrora FAILED =====
Validation FAILED for avrora small

Changeset: a8e3a2dd
Author: Eirik Bjorsnos <eirbjo@gmail.com>
Committer: Jaikiran Pai <jpai@openjdk.org>
Date: 2023-04-10 08:32:19 +0000
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/commit/a8e3a2dd2f8025986501f59f085afeffa6559e6b

A pull request was submitted for review.
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/pull/13092
Date: 2023-03-19 09:01:26 +0000

Seems Eclipse OpenJ9 still has native implementations of methods in java.lang.Compiler, while OpenJDK removed the native implementation in JDK-8057777.

[~smarks] Are we still good to remove java.lang.Compiler, despite the OpenJ9 use?
Moving to JDK 14 terminal deprecations (JDK-8225320).
